page.title: 06BRIEF REVIEW OF PLACE NAMES
page.content: Dorking,once Dorce-Ing,we know was a Saxon settlement because Ing has been found to mean a larg family or tribe living together in a small area. We presume that Dorce was a family living in that area in Saxon times. We have proof because of all the other Saxon place name endings there are around Dorking,such as:- Ham...Brockham,Beldhamas fm and Horsham Rd. Ton...Brymton Rd,Barrington Rd, Cliftonville and Feltons fm Hurst.Elmhurst Drive,Tilehurst lane and farm and little Brockhamhurst farm. Ford..Beresford Rd and Walford Rd Bury..Bushbury,Bushbury lane and farm and Lowburys Rd. Lay or Leigh.The village of Leigh, Leigh fm.
